job_title: Patient Service Representative in Boston, MA
pros:
•	Community based
•	Diversity among staff members (age and background)
•	Culture is nice
•	Food being provided during meetings
•	More than one elevator 
•	Free wifi 
•	Flu shot provided to all staff members
cons:
•	Hiring freeze on all open positions that aren’t currently grant funded
•	Lay off of temps
•	Freezing of all pay increases
•	No work from home options for those that can
•	Lack of communication amongst departments and staff members
•	CEO is not a strong leader
•	Company is very slow in making decisions that will positively affect staff members.
•	1 hour lunches changed to 30 minutes
o	Not enough time to eat and relax for a moment from the busy work day
•	PSRs are unappreciated and heavily under staffed.
o	In need of a PSR lead
o	Administration has stated for months there is no clearance to hire new PSRs
•	Not enough staff members who speak another language (Creole, French, Portuguese, and Spanish)

review_title: Mission Driven..May At Times Forget Staff
pros: Great co-workers, non profit that helps the community.
cons: low pay...impossible to get salary adjustments or promotions unless you have done the job for months. If someone leaves the position will not necessarily be filled, you're expected to take on all of their responsibility without compensation.

pros: very beneficial for the the community.
cons: outsourcing too many jobs in the community
